page.title: 02Gorran - Farming
page.content: Farming has been the main occupation in this area for more than a thousand years.There are four farms here - Lamledra (86 acres) owned by the National Trust,mostly rough grazing for beef cattle,also has some fields of corn.Carvinnick (72 acres) owned by Cornwall County Council,has grassland for grazing,hay and silage,and some arable land.A small Friesian milking herd and some sheep are also kept.Penare (200 acres) owned by the National Trust,has cliff grassland and intensively managed grassland.Beef and dairy cattle are raised - mainly Charollais and Friesians.Treveague (160 acres) owned by the Whetter family,has extensively managed grassland for grazing,hay and silage. Beef cattle are reared,and some corn is grown.There is also a campsite.
